page.title: 05DAIRYING IN LITTLE BADDOW
page.content: West Bowers Farm concentrates on dairy farming and the main produce is milk. Each cow on the farm gives about 5000 litres of milk a year.The milk was sold locally but now it is sold to the Milk Marketing Board. The milking procedure for the cows is simple but effective.Before entering the milking parlour the cows gather in the collecting yard.They are then hearded into stalls where they are milked by machine.Using this method the farmer can milk 80 cows in one hour. The main breed of cow on the farm is the Fresian,although there are some cross-breeds.They are fed on cow cake, pellets and hay in the winter and these plus grass for the rest of the year.This food contains all that a cow needs to make it stong and healthy.
